DataElement.preferredName: Preparative Regimen Alteration From Original Plan Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not preparative regimen alteration occurred from the original plan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Preparative Regimen Alteration From Original Plan Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur._A change resulting in something that is different from the original._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed._To devise, contrive, or form in design._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
The act or process of modifying something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
